data.meta_desc: I'm a game developer in a start-up company we're finishing our first game by october. I'm wondering what's the most important thing y'all think a game must have It's just got to be fun my dude. Don't worry about realism or being innovative or whatever. If you're not having fun testing it we won't have fun playing it. Too many startups try to reinvent the wheel with whacky inventory systems and weird combat mechanics. If you can make those work brilliant but at its core the base gameplay needs to feel good. anime titties of course. Anime Tiddies.  Memes.

If you're not having fun testing it we won't have fun playing it. Too many startups try to reinvent the wheel with whacky inventory systems and weird combat mechanics.
